greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Signed triangle of D'Arcais numbers (A008298) : coefficients of r in the polynomials generated by the series coefficients of z^n in Product[(1-z^k)^r, {k,1,Inf}]*(n!).
comment: Also the Bell transform of -A038048(n+1). For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 26 2016
example: The z-expansion of Product[(1-z^k)^r, {k,1,3}] is 1 - r*z + ((-3+r)*r*z^2)/2 -(r*(8-9*r +r^2)*z^3)/6, so the third row of the triangle is 0,-8,9,-1.
maple: # The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.
P := proc(n, x) option remember; if n = 0 then 1 else
Trow := n -> seq(n!*coeff(P(n, x), x, k), k=0..n):
mathematica: w=16;(CoefficientList[ #, r]&/@ CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1-z^k)^r, {k, 1, w}], {z, 0, w}], z])Range[0, w]!
BellMatrix[f_, len_] := With[{t = Array[f, len, 0]}, Table[BellY[n, k, t], {n, 0, len - 1}, {k, 0, len - 1}]];
Table[B[[n, k]], {n, 1, rows}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2018, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Jan 07 2003
